author: lgo
msg: Fix issue #1808: if a file in a working copy is replaced by a special file,
don't delete it during an update. This fixes a data loss issue.
(svn_wc_remove_from_revision_control): check if a local non-special file was
overwritten by a special file. If that's the case, consider the file locally

author: glasser
msg: If a 'svn mkdir' fails because intermediate directories don't exist,
(svn_cl__mkdir): If svn_client_mkdir3 fails with one of a particular set
of errors, wrap the error in a suggestion to try --parents.
that an erroneous mkdir gives the --parents suggestion.

author: hwright
msg: Rev the svn_log_message_receiver_t interface, and the svn_repos_get_logs()
interface to match it.  This introduces the svn_log_entry_t data structure so
that we don't have to rev the interface again when adding more information
This doesn't update all affected APIs; it is more of a checkpoint commit as I
work up our library stack.  Tests should still pass, though.
(send_change_rev): Use the new callback interface, creating a
svn_log_entry_t structure to hold the outgoing data.
(svn_repos_get_logs4): New function.  Use the new callback interface.
(svn_repos_get_logs3): Reimplement as a wrapper around svn_repos_get_logs4().

author: lgo
msg: Fix issue 2047: make the 'implicit path' merge syntax work for local paths
somewhere deeper in the directory structure.
(svn_cl__merge): if the sourcepath is a local path (relative to the working
directory), use it to determine the expected target path.

author: lgo
msg: Fix handling of svn:eol-style property updates during merge. Pass the list
of property changes to be applied during the merge down to
svn_wc__merge_internal which already has the required logic to translate the
target file based on incoming svn:eol-style property changes.
(svn_wc_merge3, svn_wc_merge2, svn_wc_merge): add new svn_wc_merge3. This
adds the prop_diff parameter, used by svn_wc__merge_internal to translate
the target file to the new eol-style if needed.
(merge_file_changed): use svn_wc_merge3 from now on. Update comments.
